overview: Rapid advancements in technology (particularly the internet) combined with fast and cheap computing power has enable firms to radically transform their industries by developing business models and reengineering their supply chains. This component provides students with (i) knowledge of mathematical modelling and analytic tools relating to logistics and supply chain optimization problems, (ii) the ability to use these tools and techniques to analyse strategic, tactical and operational decisions pertaining to inventory management, facility location, logistics and other supply chain management related decisions and (iii) exposure to real world logistics and supply chain decisions through case studies.

assessments.description: Final examination. 2 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Students are required to pass the final examination to pass the subject

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
